result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe NMI Taylor

records.addlTxt:
11:21 AM Defendant Joe NMI Taylor in court. Attorney Michael Kelsey makes special appearance in person for Joe NMI Taylor.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Kelsey would like a reset, all parties agree. Court schedules. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.    State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Kelsey no objection.  Court sets bond.  SIBS $5000  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.
